content: from an envelope of sewing crochet and knitting patterns dated 1947 crocheted apron 9666 this pattern contains directions to crochet the apron shown this apron pattern is a 1940s loose leaf pattern that was part of a free offer - the original being labeled this is your free gift this is a more advanced pattern in that it does not supply the chart but more detailed direction on gauges and creating the blocks and spaces it is quite a delightful design with bottom band of three floral row as well as 4 vertical flower panels it is a half apron with ties materials use a no 4 steel hook and mercerized fast-color string weight thread the gauge is 7 filet spaces = 2 and 7 row of spaces = 2 you will need about 580 yards of cream thread the basic color 100 yards of pink 22 yards of green 25 yards of yellow and 23 yards of blue
